metadata.title: CVE-2016-6515 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The auth_password function in auth-passwd.c in sshd in OpenSSH before 7.3does not limit password lengths for password authentication, which allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (crypt CPU consumption) via along string.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6515` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.1
openssh-client-ssh1 - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.1
openssh-server - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.1
openssh-sftp-server - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.1
ssh - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.1
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.1
ssh-krb5 - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.1').
